div.p: The type of an element - one of the FHIR data types
This value set defines it's own terms in the system http://hl7.org/fhir/data-types

tr.td: There is a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. This format defines a superset that is the basis for addresses all around the world.
The unit must be an amount of time and a UCUM unit must be provided, and the value must be positive
For referring to data content defined in other formats.
A code taken from a short list of codes that are not defined in a formal code system.
A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.
A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
All kinds of technology mediated contact details for a person or organisation, including telephone, email, etc.
The value must a whole number and the UCUM unit must be "1"
The unit must be an amount of length and a UCUM unit must be provided.
The unit must be an amount of time and a UCUM unit must be provided.
Optional Extensions Element - found in all resources.
A human's name with the ability to identify parts and usage.
A technical identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously.
The unit must be a currency and the code must from ISO 4217 (system = "urn:std:iso:4217")
A human readable formatted text, including images.
A time period defined by a start and end time.

A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.
A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.
A ratio of two Quantity values - a numerator and a denominator.
A reference from one resource to another.
A series of measurements taken by a device, with upper and lower limits. There may be more than one dimension in the data.
A schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Schedules are not used for recording when things did happen, but when they are expected or requested to occur.
A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents
A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no timezone. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date. Dates must be valid dates.

A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a timezone must be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds may be provided but may also be ignored. Dates must be valid dates.
A rational number with implicit precision
A whole number in the range 0 to 2^64-1, optionally represented in hex, a uuid, an oid or any other combination of lower-case letters a-z, numerals, "-" and ".", with a length limit of 36 characters
An instant in time - known at least to the second
An oid represented as a URI
String of characters used to identify a name or a resource
A UUID, represented as a URI

description.value: The type of an element - one of the FHIR data types

definition.value: There is a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. This format defines a superset that is the basis for addresses all around the world.
The unit must be an amount of time and a UCUM unit must be provided, and the value must be positive
For referring to data content defined in other formats.
A code taken from a short list of codes that are not defined in a formal code system.
A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.
A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
All kinds of technology mediated contact details for a person or organisation, including telephone, email, etc.
The value must a whole number and the UCUM unit must be "1"
The unit must be an amount of length and a UCUM unit must be provided.
The unit must be an amount of time and a UCUM unit must be provided.
Optional Extensions Element - found in all resources.
A human's name with the ability to identify parts and usage.
A technical identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously.
The unit must be a currency and the code must from ISO 4217 (system = "urn:std:iso:4217")
A human readable formatted text, including images.
A time period defined by a start and end time.

A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.
A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.
A ratio of two Quantity values - a numerator and a denominator.
A reference from one resource to another.
A series of measurements taken by a device, with upper and lower limits. There may be more than one dimension in the data.
A schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Schedules are not used for recording when things did happen, but when they are expected or requested to occur.
A stream of bytes
Value of "true" or "false"
A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents
A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no timezone. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date. Dates must be valid dates.

A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a timezone must be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds may be provided but may also be ignored. Dates must be valid dates.
A rational number with implicit precision
A whole number in the range 0 to 2^64-1, optionally represented in hex, a uuid, an oid or any other combination of lower-case letters a-z, numerals, "-" and ".", with a length limit of 36 characters
An instant in time - known at least to the second
A whole number
An oid represented as a URI
A sequence of Unicode characters
String of characters used to identify a name or a resource
A UUID, represented as a URI
